metadata.title: CVE-2019-11454 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Persistent cross-site scripting (XSS) in http/cervlet.c in Tildeslash Monit before 5.25.3 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to introduce arbitrary JavaScript via manipulation of an unsanitized user field of the Authorization header for HTTP Basic Authentication, which is mishandled during an _viewlog operation. Zack Flack discovered that Monit incorrectly handled certain input. A remote authenticated user could exploit this to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-11454` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

monit - 1:5.25.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: monit package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:5.25.3-1').
